question: An unpolarised light of intensity I is passed through two polaroids kept one after the other with their planes parallel to each other. The intensity of light emerging from second polaroid is <katex>$\frac{I}{4}$</katex>. The angle between the pass axes of the polaroids is
explanation: Intensity after first polaroid <katex>$I_1 = I/2$</katex>. By Malus' Law, intensity after second is <katex>$I_2 = I_1 \cos^2 \theta = (I/2) \cos^2 \theta$</katex>. Given <katex>$I_2 = I/4$</katex>, so <katex>$(I/2) \cos^2 \theta = I/4 \Rightarrow \cos^2 \theta = 1/2 \Rightarrow \cos \theta = 1/\sqrt{2} \Rightarrow \theta = 45^{\circ}$</katex>.
